page.title: 15SOUTHALL HORSE MARKET
page.content: There has been a horse market in Southall since about 1698 and it is still held every Wednesday afternoon. The auction starts with the sale of tack and carriages. After that the horses are sold. Some 100 horses are sold every week. They are run up and down in front of the buyers to show off their paces. Most of the horses are well groomed with their manes and tails plaited. Then the auctioneer starts the bidding. Prices vary depending on whether the horse is going for horsemeat, when they fetch low prices or for future use as show or carriage horses. Buyers of carriage horses are allowed a few days to try out the horse. Sometimes horses are sold again after the auction, when the sign of acceptance of the deal is a handslap.
